private_information: Initial conditions: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_3, hand object_8, next object_0 object_7, next object_1 object_7, next object_4 object_6, next object_5 object_7, next object_8 object_7, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_7, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7. Goal: next object_8 object_6. Plan: sip object_8 object_1 object_7; memory object_1 object_7 object_6; paltry object_8 object_1 object_6.
player.goal: Analyze the provided initial state and the human plan, produce a structured partial model of predicates, grounded facts used by the plan, and identify any missing prerequisites or causal links without emitting PDDL.

private_information: Initial conditions: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_2, hand object_7, hand object_8, next object_0 object_6, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_6, next object_7 object_6, next object_8 object_5, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_6, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6. Goal: next object_7 object_6 and next object_8 object_6. Plan: (none provided).
observer.goal: Analyze this alternate initial state, produce a structured partial model of predicates and reachable goals, and propose any minimal corrective steps or dependencies that would enable the goal.

private_information: Role: audit temporal and causal consistency, detect and eliminate bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit quota tokens or post-hoc penalties, and produce a corrected causal sequence or recommendations.
auditor.goal: Examine partial models and plans from other agents, validate temporal and causal consistency, and produce an audit report that removes bookkeeping shortcuts and highlights necessary factual changes.

private_information: Role: integrate partial models and audit reports from other agents and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward planner.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate inputs from the player, observer, and auditor and emit a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and problem that achieves the stated goals while keeping agent actions distinct.

public_information: Available predicates include hand X, cats X, texture X, vase X Y, next X Y, collect X Y, sneeze X, spring X, stupendous X.
Action paltry requires preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2. Effects: add next o0 o2; delete vase o0 o1.
Action sip requires preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2. Effects: add vase o0 o1; delete next o0 o2.
Action clip requires preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2. Effects: add vase o0 o1; delete next o0 o2.
Action wretched requires preconditions: sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3. Effects: add next o0 o2; delete next o0 o1.
Action memory requires preconditions: cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1. Effects: add next o0 o2; delete next o0 o1.
Action tightfisted requires preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1. Effects: add next o0 o2; delete vase o0 o1.
Objects are named object_0 through object_8 and may appear as variables in action specifications. The environment uses classical predicate logic with additions and deletions as effects.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the player agent tasked with analyzing a concrete initial state and a human-proposed plan. Produce a structured partial model listing grounded predicates present in the initial state, the grounded preconditions consumed by each planned action, the grounded effects produced by each planned action, and a causal link trace showing how the plan is intended to achieve the goal. Do not emit PDDL. If information is missing, list the missing facts or assumptions explicitly.
analysis.prompt: Your name is player. Use the public environment model: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->player->private_information}. Produce a JSON-like structured partial model containing: predicates used, initial facts instantiated, for each plan step the preconditions and effects grounded to objects, and a causal link analysis indicating which effects satisfy which later preconditions. Explicitly list any missing preconditions or ambiguous object bindings.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the observer agent analyzing an alternate initial state and goal. Produce a structured partial model summarizing instantiated predicates, reachable subgoals, and suggestions for minimal corrective actions to enable the stated goals. Do not emit PDDL.
analysis.prompt: Your name is observer. Use the public environment model: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->observer->private_information}. Produce a JSON-like structured partial model containing: instantiated initial facts, an assessment of which goals are already satisfied, which goals are reachable with currently available actions, and any minimal additional facts or steps required. Identify any ambiguous or underspecified object roles.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor whose job is to check temporal and causal consistency, to remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit quota tokens or post-hoc penalties, and to produce a corrected causal model or recommendations. Produce an audit report that is actionable and that corrects or flags any temporal ordering problems, missing causal links, unjustified deletes, or bookkeeping artifacts. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Receive partial models: {model_player} and {model_observer}. Validate temporal ordering and causal links across the models, identify any bookkeeping shortcuts, and produce a cleaned partial model and an audit summary. The audit summary should list required factual additions, recommended re-orderings, and clarifications necessary for a sound plan. Provide explicit examples of how to remove bookkeeping shortcuts and produce corrected grounded facts.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for integrating partial models and the audit report and emitting a final FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and problem. Produce a classical PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward using only constructs supported by classical FastDownward (STRIPS-style typing and standard add/delete effects). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing action names with the originating agent id when appropriate.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Integrate inputs: {model_player}, {model_observer}, and {audit_report}. Your goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Resolve naming inconsistencies, unify object identities, incorporate audit corrections, maintain distinct action names for different agent roles, and emit a complete PDDL domain and problem pair targeting FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If information is underspecified, document the assumptions explicitly at the top of the problem file as comments.
